summary: This is an email from a Wall Street Journal reporter containing a news summary about the upcoming trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. It reports on Maxwell's charges, the claims of Jeffrey Epstein's accusers seeking justice, and the official determination of Epstein's death as a suicide.

persons.name: Alex Janin
persons.context: The sender of the email, identified as a Wall Street Journal reporter.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as Jeffrey Epstein's longtime friend, confidante, and employee, who is on trial for sex trafficking charges including grooming girls for Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The disgraced financier whose death by suicide was determined by a medical examiner; his accusers are seeking justice in Maxwell's trial.

connections.description: Described as Epstein's longtime friend, confidante, and employee; accused of grooming girls for him.
Prosecutors accuse Maxwell of grooming four anonymous women as teenagers for Epstein.
The anonymous women are accusers who were allegedly groomed for Epstein by Maxwell.

events.title: Maxwell Hearing
events.description: During a hearing, Ghislaine Maxwell stated she had committed no crime.

events.title: Epstein's Death Ruled Suicide
events.description: A medical examiner determined Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide more than two years prior to this article.

events.title: Maxwell Trial Begins
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell goes on trial this week, with accusers seeing an opportunity for closure.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's trial for sex trafficking charges is beginning, with prosecutors accusing her of grooming girls for Jeffrey Epstein between 1994 and 2004.
A medical examiner officially determined Jeffrey Epstein's death was a suicide, which occurred more than two years prior to this November 2021 report.
The indictment cites four anonymous women who prosecutors say were groomed as teenagers by Maxwell for Epstein.
During a hearing, Maxwell asserted she had committed no crime in response to the charges against her.
